titleStmt.title: Letter from H. C. Bunner to Samuel L. Clemens: an electronic text

p.bibl: The Mark Twain Papers, The Bancroft Library, University of California, Berkeley (CU-MARK).

body.head:
Henry C. Bunner to Samuel L. Clemens 31 March 1884 • New York, N.Y.
(MS: CU-MARK, UCLC 41860)

div1.p: Will you pardon the strangeness of the request if I venture to ask you for your autograph, for my little grand-daughter, now two weeks old?
The little innocent, abroad in this strange world of ours, will, I am sure, value your gift when she is old enough to appreciate it.

My son-in-law LaurenceBunner was twenty-eight years old and unmarried at the time of this letter, so clearly he had no son-in-law or grandchildren. (He did marry in 1885.) "Laurence" refers to his good friend Laurence Hutton, who also participated in the hoax (see his 31 March letter to Clemens). Incidentally, he did name one of his sons Laurence, who was born in 1894. sends you his regards. Believe me
